title: Font I.D. request
content:
Since I had such good results with my last request I thought I would give the geniuses another one to figure out. I have tried numerous font i.d. sites with no luck. Hope someone on here can help.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [ripple-products.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905085554/http:/typophile.com/files/ripple-products_0.jpg) | 30.85 KB |

 [‹ Need help identify these](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905085554/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42802 "Go to previous forum topic") [Music ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905085554/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42918 "Go to next forum topic")
author: numberseven

comments.content:
Here are a few more letters in case they help.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905085554im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/about-ripple_5279.jpg)

The lack of overshoot on the ’O’ leads me to believe this is a free or amateur font.

- Lex
As does the ’B’. It’s got some [Isonorm](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905085554/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=isonorm) in it.

Thanks for your help. I just found out is is Grayscale Basic. It is available at the link below if anyone wants it.

[http://www.greyscale.net/basic/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905085554/http:/www.greyscale.net/basic/ "http://www.greyscale.net/basic/")
